--- pagetitle: "r-dcm" image: "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/r-dcm/hex-stickers/refs/heads/main/svg/r-dcm.svg" image-alt: "r-dcm hexagon logo" engine: knitr toc: false format: html: grid: margin-width: 100px sidebar-width: 100px body-width: 1100px link-external-newwindow: true about: template: trestles id: hero-heading listing: id: pkgs type: grid grid-columns: 3 categories: false sort-ui: false filter-ui: false fields: [title, image, description] image-height: 200px grid-item-border: false grid-item-align: center contents: - title: measr path: https://measr.r-dcm.org/ image: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/r-dcm/hex-stickers/refs/heads/main/svg/measr.svg image-alt: measr hexagon logo description: Estimate and evaluate DCMs with *R* and *Stan*. - title: dcmdata path: https://dcmdata.r-dcm.org/ image: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/r-dcm/hex-stickers/refs/heads/main/svg/dcmdata.svg image-alt: dcmdata hexagon logo description: Example datasets for testing and teaching. - title: dcmstan path: https://dcmstan.r-dcm.org/ image: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/r-dcm/hex-stickers/refs/heads/main/svg/dcmstan.svg image-alt: dcmstan hexagon logo description: | Generate *Stan* code for customizing your model. --- ::::{#FrontPage} :::{#hero-heading} ## Diagnostic psychometrics with R The r-dcm suite is a collection of packages for estimating and evaluating diagnostic classification models in [*R*](https://r-project.org) using [tidyverse](https://tidyverse.org) principles. What do you need to know to start using the r-dcm packages? [{{< fa flag-checkered >}} Get started](start/index.qmd) by learning what you need in four articles, starting with how to specify a model and ending with a beginning-to-end case study. :::
